questions.question: What is batch processing in the context of big data?
options: Processing data in small, continuous streams
Processing large volumes of data in bulk
questions.answer: Processing large volumes of data in bulk

questions.question: What framework is commonly associated with batch processing?
What is the role of HDFS in batch processing?
options: To distribute processing tasks among nodes
To provide scalable and fault-tolerant storage for large datasets
To stream real-time data to users
questions.answer: To provide scalable and fault-tolerant storage for large datasets

questions.question: What is the primary feature of stream processing?
options: Processing data as soon as it is received
questions.answer: Processing data as soon as it is received

questions.question: Which is a common use case for stream processing?
What is the key difference between batch and stream processing?
options: Batch processing is for real-time analytics, stream processing is not
Stream processing processes data as it arrives, while batch processing works on accumulated data
Batch processing is faster than stream processing
Stream processing requires Hadoop, batch processing does not
questions.answer: Stream processing processes data as it arrives, while batch processing works on accumulated data

questions.question: What is a publish-subscribe (pub-sub) architecture?

A model where publishers push data to topics, and subscribers pull messages from these topics
questions.answer: A model where publishers push data to topics, and subscribers pull messages from these topics
